questions.question: I will call you when I ………………………. ready.
questions.description: When both clauses refer to the future, we use the simple present in the subordinate clause.

questions.question: She told me that she ……………………………. quitting.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.

questions.question: People loved him because he …………………………… very kind.
If you buy the tickets, I ………………………… the food.
questions.description: In the first conditional, we use a simple present tense in the if-clause and will + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: She was not very beautiful but she ………………………….. very popular.
We climbed up a tree so that we …………………………… get a better view of the procession.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.

questions.question: They took him to hospital when he …………………………….. of uneasiness.
No one helped me when I ……………………… money.
While I was mowing the lawn, a scorpion ………………………… me.
questions.description: We use the past continuous for a longer background action that was going on while another action interrupted it.

questions.question: He talks as if he ………………………… an insider but he isn’t.
questions.description: We use a past tense with a present meaning after as if and as though to show that a comparison is unreal.

questions.question: As well as …………………………. his parents, he invited the displeasure of his boss.
While you were holidaying in France, I …………………………….. the midnight oil.
